titleInfo.title: Types of experimental nutria fur stretchers

mods.abstract: Types of experimental nutria fur stretchers designed by the Animal Trap Company of America and tested for performance. Left to right: (1) two-bar lock with wooden block; (2) 1-piece lock with wooden block; (3) two-bar lock, hook teeth cut in one bar; (4) two-bar lock, hook teetch cut in both bar; (5) two-bar lock, with 14 fish hooks, all metal; (6) two-bar lock, hook teetch cut in both bars; and (7) 1-piece lock, pin-up, all metal.

titleInfo.title: Louisiana Sea Grant Digital Images Collection

mods.accessCondition: Copyright of federal and state documents is in the public domain.
Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
mods.note: Dozier, H. L. and F. G. Ashbrook. 1950. A practical drying frame for nutria pelts. Louisiana Conservationist 3(2):16-18.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
